I'm not because I play Dominion. Since we don't get champion mastery points this means we aren't going to be getting any drops either (drops are tied to your endgame grade).

Murder Bridge and Treeline players should be equally dismayed at yet another cool feature they miss out on.

What if... They still granted drops on alternate maps, based on the average of SR? So if you play on SR you'd get drops based on your performance, and on other maps you'd get drops based on average. That way alternate map players would still get drops, despite not having champion mastery.
I'd be fine with that in one of those "better than nothing" compromise kind of ways.

I like the idea, but this has the easy potential to go straight to microtransaction town. 

'Oh, do you only need one more key fragment to finish off that key? We sell them in the store!'
'Oh, do you have a lot of keys but no chests? Don't worry, we'll sell you chests in the store!'
What's your point?  At least LOL will never be pay to win.  Honestly, micro transactions are just really cleaver ways to sell people stuff.  Kind of like buying individual legos.

They are advertising this system as 'a way to get free stuff.'

As such, if it ends up being not free, they are, at the very least, dishonest.
That's why it's called marketing :P
